description.narrative: Improved Early Child Development (ECD) policy environment and coordination mechanisms that support optimal development of children, which contributes to Early Childhood Development. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Young children and families, especially the most vulnerable, are utilizing quality Early Child Development (ECD) services

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Improved ECD policy environment and coordination mechanisms that support optimal development of children

description.narrative: ECD policy environment continued to improve. NECDP continued to receive guidance from the Prime Minister's Office, a pointer to government commitment in advancing the ECD agenda. Coordination of the programme at national level remained high. The national ECD Sub-cluster increased participation and integration of key thematic areas of health, nutrition, education, WASH and protection. This enhanced delivery of an integrated programme and provision of holistic child development services. Plans are underway to replicate the national coordination gains at decentralised levels which are weak. This will improve provision of comprehensive ECD services at community level for optimal child growth and development. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:07/08/2020

title.narrative: # of districts that incorporate district ECD models into their plans and budgets
Multisectoral ECD coordination mechanisms established and implemented at national and district levels
